title: What should we do to move forward with our tech startup after building a prototype of the application? - Quora

response.answer_text: The question I would ask you, would be what does it mean to you to “move forward?” Your mysterious prototype (about which we know nothing please keep in mind), might or might not work. Maybe it’s been tested with target consumers, probably not. Would it work? Would it break if used by children or consumers? Does it require hours of studying manuals to install or use? We don’t know. How much money would purchasing your item cost, and is that commensurate with your target market? Again,we don’t know. I’ve met many, many “startup founders.” I’ve yet to meet one who has tested everything, has proper financing, has exit strategies in place if that’s what their end game is, have proper shares for co-founders and key staff, or are financially sound with growth strategies. Maybe I don’t get out enough, but starting any kind of business is very tough and it’s tougher still if you don’t research, research, and do more research. So I would recommend testing out your prototype, asking around for test groups in your area, and networking with other similar founders near you.

Test it out! Get feedback. Run some Facebook ads to see what the interest is. Do some surveys. Get feedback from at least 20 people to see if any issues come up. If you have a monetization strategy, test the business model to see if users are willing to pay. From there, scale it, maybe look for capital if you really want it. At some point upgrade your design, features, etc, after you know there is an interest in it.
